tit.e: Inba no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)
tit.cmt: (government post) government postには違いないと思いますが、これだと中央官僚のようにも聞こえるので、regional governor in ancient Japan（古代日本の地域の統括者）としました。
tit.e: Inba no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)

sen.j: 印波国造（いんばのくにのみやつこ・いんばこくぞう)は下総国中部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Inbanokuninomiyatsuko (also known as Inbakokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the middle part of Kazusa Province.
Inba no kuni no miyatsuko (also known as Inbakokuzo) was a kuni no miyatsuko that ruled the middle part of Kazusa Province.
Inba no kuni no miyatsuko (also known as Inbakokuzo) was a kuni no miyatsuko that ruled the middle part of Kazusa Province.

sen.j: 現在の千葉県成田市・佐倉市・八街市・四街道市・印西市・印旛郡。
sen.e: Present Narita City, Sakura City, Yachimata City, Yotsukaido City, Inzai City, and Inbagun, Chiba Prefecture.
